com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom
Interface Geometry

All Known Implementing Classes:
FlatGeometry, SphericalGeometry
public interface Geometry

Interface for the geometry classes to implement

Method Detail

getHeight

float getHeight(XYZ p)
Get the height of a given point in this geometry.

Parameters:
p - The point representing the coordinates to be queried
Returns:
The height of the specified point relative to assumed sea level at 0.0

setHeight

void setHeight(XYZ p,
               float v)
Set the height of a point in this geometry.

Parameters:
p - The point with the height that is to be set
v - The new height to assign (relative to zero being sea level)

Get the midpoint between two points in this geometry.

Parameters:

Returns:
The midpoint between the two points

getNormalisedLatitude

float getNormalisedLatitude(XYZ p)
Get the normalised latitude for a point in this geometry. Normalised latitude is 1.0 at the north pole, -1.0 at the south pole

Parameters:
p - The point to get the latitude for
Returns:
The normalised latitude of the point

perturb

XYZ perturb(XYZ v,
            XYZ variation)
Adds a random peturbation to a point up to the specified amount

Parameters:
v - The point to be subjected to peturbation
variation - The maximum amount of random variation to appy
Returns:
A new peturbed point. The input value is not modified

epsilon

float epsilon()
Nasty hack to work around height setting possibly not being exact. In some geometries (e.g spherical, but not flat) modifying a point to be at a particular height does not guarantee that exact value will be returned on a susequent height query. If this is the case, a non-zero epsilon value can be returned and used as an error tolerence when comparing two heights for equivalence.

Returns:
The error tolerance for this geometry
